Extracting aggregated trade data

Source: vignettes/articles/extracting-aggregates.Rmd
extracting-aggregates.Rmd

Trade data is often reclassified following different standards; see Concordance Table for all mappings that are possible using comtradeRggregator.

However, in all those cases the internal logic of the conversion is that we use ‘all’ trade data, which is then mapped onto a different classification. What if, in turn, we want to extract only a set of traded commodities that belong to only a specific sub-group of the target classification?

In the example below we assume we want to extract all SITC Rev. 2 (S2) trade data that belongs to a very specific manufacturing sector, say, ISIC Rev. 2 (I2) sector 3530 - Petroleum refineries. We can accomplish this in a few simple steps:

First, we load the comtradeRggregator package.

library(comtradeRggregator)

Next, we extract all S2 codes that correspond to the I2 sector 3530 which we want to extract:

comm_petrol <- S2_I2 %>%
  filter(`ISIC Revision 2 Product Code` == 3530)
comm_petrol
#> # A tibble: 13 x 4
#>    `SITC Revision 2 ~ `SITC Revision 2 Pro~ `ISIC Revision 2~ `ISIC Revision 2 ~
#>    <chr>              <chr>                 <chr>             <chr>             
#>  1 334                Petroleum products,r~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~
#>  2 33452              Lubricating preparat~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~
#>  3 33511              Petroleum jelly (pet~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~
#>  4 33512              Paraffin wax,micro-c~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~
#>  5 33521              Tar distilled from c~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~
#>  6 33522              Benzole               3530              Petroleum refiner~
#>  7 33523              Toluole               3530              Petroleum refiner~
#>  8 33524              Xylole                3530              Petroleum refiner~
#>  9 33525              Oils and other produ~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~
#> 10 33531              Pitch obtain.from co~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~
#> 11 33541              Petroleum bitumen & ~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~
#> 12 33542              Petroleum coke        3530              Petroleum refiner~
#> 13 33543              Bituminous mixtures ~ 3530              Petroleum refiner~

In a next step we use the SITC commodity codes of comm_petrol as an input argument for the API query:

data_extract <- download_Comtrade(
  year = "2018",
  frequency = "annual",
  countries = "France",
  partners = "Germany",
  nomenclature = "S2",
  commodity = comm_petrol %>% pull(`SITC Revision 2 Product Code`),
  select.stats = "trade_value_usd"
)

Finally, we re-classify the extracted data back to S2 using convert_Comtrade():

convert_Comtrade(data_extract,
                 classification.from = 'S2',
                 classification.to = 'I2') %>%
  distinct(`ISIC Revision 2 Product Code`)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>   `ISIC Revision 2 Product Code`
#>   <chr>                         
#> 1 3530
